column3: Generic property specifying when or under which condition(s) the consent will expire
column14: Harshvardhan J. Pandit, Mark Lizar, Bud Bruegger

column3: Specifies the expiry time or duration for consent
column14: Harshvardhan J. Pandit, Mark Lizar, Bud Bruegger

column3: Specifies the condition or event that determines the expiry of consent
column14: Harshvardhan J. Pandit, Mark Lizar, Bud Bruegger

column3: Specifies the method by which consent was provisioned or provided
column9: Can be used to record information of how consent was provided e.g. by a click to a form, in writing, etc., by logging into a system and confirm per email, or with some additional authentication, etc.
column14: Harshvardhan J. Pandit, Mark Lizar, Bud Bruegger

column3: Specifies the instant in time when consent was given
column14: Harshvardhan J. Pandit, Mark Lizar, Bud Bruegger

column3: Specifries the method by which consent can be/has been withdrawn
column9: Can be used to record information of how to withdraw consent, e.g. by a click to a form, in writing, etc., by logging into a system and confirm per email, or with some additional authentication, etc.
column14: Harshvardhan J. Pandit, Mark Lizar, Bud Bruegger

column3: Specifies the instant in time when consent was withdrawn
column14: Harshvardhan J. Pandit, Mark Lizar, Bud Bruegger

column3: Specifies the entity that withdrew consent
column9: Normally this would be the dataSubject, but in some exceptional cases, the consent might be withdraawn on behalf by someone else, e.g. parents of minors.
column14: Harshvardhan J. Pandit, Mark Lizar, Bud Bruegger

column3: Specifies the entity that provisioned or provided consent
column9: Normally this would be the dataSubject, but in some exceptional cases, the consent might be given on behalf by someone else, e.g. parents of minors.
column14: Harshvardhan J. Pandit, Mark Lizar, Bud Bruegger

column3: Specifies the justification for entity providing consent
column9: This field can be used to proivde a justification why the provision was provided by another DataSubject or legal entity,  e.g. declariing the relationship (parent, guardian), in combination with the field provisionBy
column14: Harshvardhan J. Pandit, Mark Lizar, Bud Bruegger

column3: Specifies the justification for entity withdrawing consent
column9: This field can be used to proivde a justification why the weithdrawal was done by another DataSubject or legal entity, e.g. declariing the relationship (parent, guardian), in combination with the field withdrawalBy
column14: Harshvardhan J. Pandit, Mark Lizar, Bud Bruegger

column3: Specifies the notice provided in context of consent
column9: The actual notice that the Data Subject received to consent to, either a text or link to a document, which should be usable to decide whether the form or consent was compliant to legislation, e.g. documenting how the user has been informed about rights and implications (such as, right to data portability,right to recitffy, right to erasure, right to restrict processing, right to object, rights regarding automated decision making or profiling, processors, third parties, sub-processors, outside-EEA transfers, automated decision-making, or other necessary details of the privacy-policy). Can be TextOrDocumentOrURI.
column14: Harshvardhan J. Pandit, Mark Lizar, Bud Bruegger

column9: The conditions for what is considered 'explicit consent' differ by norms and laws.
column14: Harshvardhan J. Pandit, Mark Lizar, Bud Bruegger
